book.title: Rodzina, zdrowie, choroba

results.title: Assessment of the health status of 	patients treated in surgical wards of a randomly selected clinical hospital in Kraków 	in 2017

abstracts.content:
Objectives. The aim of the study was to evaluate predictors of health disorders in patients 
treated in surgical wards of a selected clinical hospital in Cracow. It included the assessment of cognitive activity using the MMSE test in female and male patients and the assessment of anxiety as a result of lack of independence during everyday activities using the 
FES-I test (Polish Translation of FES-I (PL)) The patients were also evaluated for nutritional 
status with the Mini Nutrial Assessment (MNA) in women and men.
Material and methods. The study was conducted in 2017 in Cracow, Poland, by randomly 
selecting a clinical hospital that has a general and orthopedic surgery department. The 5th
Military Clinical Hospital and Polyclinic was drawn for the study. Statistical analysis was 
performed in SPSS program using the following statistical methods: non-parametric test 
for independent samples (Mann–Whitney test) was used to analyze qualitative variables: 
cognitive activity, anxiety during activities of daily living as a result of lack of independence, nutritional status in the group of women and men. 
Results. There are statistically significant differences in the categories of assessment of 
anxiety during activities of daily living using the FES test in groups of women and men 
(p = 0.016). There were no statistically significant differences in the assessment of cognitive 
activity (p = 0.676) in the conducted study in the groups of women and men. Women are at 
greater risk of malnutrition than men, and malnutrition is also observed in women (45.3% 
vs 34%,11.3% vs 0%; p = 0.010).
Conclusions. Anxiety was more common in women than in men as a result of lack of 
independence during activities of daily living (85% vs 64%; p = 0.016). In the conducted 
study in groups of women and men there was no difference in the assessment of cognitive 
impairment using the MMSE test (15.1% vs 4.3%, 8.5% vs 1.9%; p = 0.676).
Edyta Laska, Małgorzata Kamińska
204
Background
 As the world population ages, the risk of various diseases, including an increasing number of surgical procedures, is growing, which may result in various complications (De Hert et al., 2018). In this context it is important to correctly assess 
the predictors of health disorders, their incidence and disease states predicting the 
body’s response to a specific treatment plan (Association of Anesthetists of Great 
Britain and Ireland, 2014). In order to carry out a successful intervention it will be 
crucial to achieve an optimal state of the patient including functional status – cognitive abilities which determine autonomous functioning, i.e., undertaking basic everyday activities (American College of Surgeons, 2012; Bień, Broczek, 2012). 
Functional capacity is particularly important in elderly patients due to age-related 
limitations, which increases the likelihood of functional dependence. This is a substrate for predictors of postoperative mortality and a risk factor for postoperative 
cognitive decline, including the presence of anxiety and depression. Patients with 
emotional imbalance and depressive features can be expected to have an increased 
frequency of noncompliance, difficulty with pain management, risk of postoperative 
delirium, and prolonged hospitalization (Albiński et al., 2011; Association of Anesthetists of Great Britain and Ireland, 2014).
Another predictor of health disorders occurring in patients hospitalized in surgical units is malnutrition caused by appetite weakness, difficulties in food intake, depression, loneliness and economic limitations. Therefore, assessment of nutritional 
status using standardized tools (NRS, SGA), screening tests (MNA) as a basis for 
implementing appropriate management schemes at each stage of the therapeutic process is very important (Jankowska-Polańska et al., 2019).
Preparing the patient for surgery should begin at the moment the decision is 
made that surgery is necessary. This process should involve the patient and his family, the therapeutic team, including a nurse, physiotherapist, and physicians of various 
specialties. In view of the risk of potential complications, which entails increased 
costs of hospitalization, it is important to properly and optimally organize the care 
of these patients, aimed at improving the quality and effects of treatment (Uchmanowicz et al., 2016).
There are statistically significant differences in the categories of nutritional status assessment using the MNA test between male and female groups (p = 0.010). Women are more 
at risk of malnutrition than men (45.3% vs 34%), and there is more malnutrition among 
women than men (11.3% vs 0%).
Key words: predictors of health disorders, surgical wards, cognitive activity, anxiety, nutrition.

results.title: Effects of ketamine optical isomers, fluoxetine and naloxone on timing in differential reinforcement of low-rate response (DRL) 72-s task in rats

abstracts.content: (S)-ketamine-induced rapid-acting antidepressant effects have revolutionized the pharmacotherapy of major depression; however, this medication also produces psychotomimetic effects such as timing distortion. While (R)-ketamine produces fewer dissociative effects, its antidepressant actions are less studied. Depression is associated with time overestimation (i.e., subjectively, time passes slowly). Our recent report suggests that while (S)-ketamine induces an opposite effect, i.e., time underestimation, the (R)-isomer does not affect timing. It has been suggested that opioid receptors are involved in the antidepressant effect of ketamine. In the present study we tested (R)- and (S)-ketamine, and fluoxetine as a positive control in the differential-reinforcement-of-low-rate (DRL) 72-s schedule of reinforcement in male rats following naloxone pretreatment. DRL classic metrics as well as peak deviation analyses served to determine antidepressant-like actions and those associated with timing. We report antidepressant-like effects of (S)-ketamine (30-60 mg/kg) that resemble fluoxetine's (2.5-10 mg/kg), as both compounds increased reinforcement rate and peak location (suggesting increased performance), reduced premature responses (suggesting time underestimation) and decreased Weber's fraction (suggesting increased timing precision). (R)-ketamine (30, but not 60 mg/kg) increased only the reinforcement rate and peak location but did not affect timing. Only fluoxetine decreased burst responses, suggesting decreased impulsivity. Naloxone pretreatment did not block ketamine enantiomers' actions, but unexpectedly, increased fluoxetine' performance. Thus, while all three medications produced antidepressant-like effects in DRL 72-s, fluoxetine- and (S)- but not (R)- ketamine-induced time underestimation (the subject experiences the time as passing quickly). The potentiation of DRL performance of fluoxetine by naloxone was unexpected and warrants clinical studies.

results.title: Diffusion and surface charge studies of waste cow dung derived highly porous carbon as a facile electrode for solid-state supercapacitors

abstracts.content: Carbon-based materials generated from biowaste have recently attracted interest due to their exceptional surface and conductive properties. Cow dung derived porous carbon (CDPC) with a 3D structure and linked pores is synthesized in this study, making it an alternative electrode for supercapacitors (SC). Herein, we studied the diffusion and surface charge contribution and their relationship with the scan rate. Diffusion charge contribution is more prevalent at lower scan rates. Furthermore, a large fraction of surface charge contribution of 69.2 % at a high scan rate of 100 mV/s indicates rapid electrochemical kinetics and hence high-rate performance even at higher current densities. In addition, utilizing a 1 M H2SO4 electrolyte, the CDPC electrode has attained a high specific capacitance value of 210 F/g at 0.5 A/g. Furthermore, symmetrical solid-state SC device displayed high energy density of 36 Wh/kg at good power density of 800 W/kg along with remarkable cyclic stability of 92.6 % after 10,000 charge-discharge cycles. Hence, these findings demonstrate that investigating surface and diffusion charge contributions opens up new avenues for tuning the supercapacitor performance.

results.title: Od rozproszenia do materializacji. Energia i entropia w sztukach wizualnych lat sześćdziesiątych a pierwszych dekad XXI wieku

abstracts.content: W artykule podjęty zostaje temat energii i entropii w sztukach wizualnych. Problematyka skoncentrowana jest wokół kluczowych przemian w strategiach artystycznych bazujących na dowartościowaniu entropii i energii, jakie zaszły między latami sześćdziesiątymi XX wieku a pierwszymi dekadami XXI stulecia. Omawiane zwroty zaprezentowane zostały na przykładzie twórczości Hansa Hackeego, Roberta Smithsona, Petera Blamey’ego, Davida Hainesa, Joyce Hinterding oraz Olafura Eliassona. Punktem wyjścia dla rozważań jest zaproponowana przez Bernarda Stieglera oraz powołany przez niego kolektyw badawczy Internacja – koncepcja entropocenu, stanowiąca o tym, że entropia jest zjawiskiem w sposób najbardziej adekwatny charakteryzującym wszelkie kryzysy epoki człowieka.

The article discusses the topic of energy and entropy in visual arts, focusing on the reformulations which took place between the 1960s and the first decades of the 21st century. The shifts discussed are presented within the antihumanist turn of the 1960s, when entropy proved useful for various artists (especially Hans Hacke and Robert Smithson) in their postulates on the autonomy of a work of art, and the later, within the turn of materialisation of energy and entropy in the context of ecological crises (which is the main focus of such artists as Peter Blamey, David Haines, Joyce Hinterding or Olafur Eliasson). This research stems from the concept of the Entropocene, proposed by Bernard Stiegler, which states that entropy is a phenomenon that most adequately characterizes all crises of the human era.

otherTitles.title: From Dispersion to Materialisation. Energy and Entropy in Visual Arts – From 1960s to 2010s
